title: Parsing protobuf at 2+GB/s: how I learned to love tail calls in C (2021)
dot:
digraph TailCalls{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box, style=rounded, fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10]; tail_call_opt[label="Tail Call Optimization
(O(1) stack space)", shape=ellipse, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue];performance[label="Performance
Reduction in Stack Memory
No Stack Overflow", shape=ellipse, style=filled, fillcolor=lightyellow];compiler[label="Compiler Support
musttail (Clang)", shape=ellipse, style=filled, fillcolor=lightgreen]; protobuf[label="Protobuf Parsing
2GB/s speedup", shape=ellipse, style=filled, fillcolor=lightcoral];tail_call_parser[label="Tail Call Parser Design
(faster parsing)", shape=ellipse, style=filled, fillcolor=lightpink]; interpreters[label="Interpreters
(Python, Ruby, PHP, Lua, etc.)", shape=ellipse, style=filled, fillcolor=lightcyan];interpreter_opt[label="Interpreter Optimization
with Tail Calls", shape=ellipse, style=filled, fillcolor=lightyellow]; tail_call_opt->performance[label="enables"];tail_call_opt->compiler[label="requires"];performance->protobuf[label="used in"];protobuf->tail_call_parser[label="enhanced by"];tail_call_parser->protobuf[label="accelerates"]; tail_call_opt->interpreters[label="can optimize"];interpreters->interpreter_opt[label="boosted by"]; iteration[label="Tail Calls as Iteration
(better than loops)", shape=ellipse, style=filled, fillcolor=lightgreen];tail_call_parser->iteration[label="replaces loops"];interpreter_opt->iteration[label="applies in interpreter loops"]; limitation[label="Limitations
(portability, non-tail calls break optimization)", shape=box, style=dashed, fillcolor=lightgray];limitation->compiler[label="affects"]; outcome[label="Improved Code
Efficiency & Performance", shape=box, style=solid, fillcolor=lightgoldenrodyellow];tail_call_parser->outcome[label="results in"];interpreter_opt->outcome[label="results in"];}
